subject: Re: [junit] Passing Parameters From Suite To Test Class On Instantiation
msgSnippet: Did you look into JUnits parameterized Tests? Greetings, Malte
messageBody:
Did you look into JUnits parameterized Tests?

Greetings,
Malte

gwittel_pp wrote:
> I have a scenario where I have a Suite and I'd like to pass parameters to each test class constructor. For example, I want to pass a database handle object to the test class. The database handle is set up in the Suite's @BeforeClass routine. Effectively I'd like to have the suite do the following for each class given by the @SuiteClasses:
>
> @SuiteClassParam List<Object> params;
>
> // ...setup db hhandle....
> params.add(myDbHandle);
>
> // ....this is how I'd want the runner to handle my code above
> MyTestClass1 c = new MyTestClass1(params)
> // ... run tests from 'c'.
> MyTestClass2 c2 = new MyTestClass2(params)
> // ... run tests from 'c2'.
>
> Is something like this possible? I looked at the Parameterised runner, but that seems to iterate over the arguments from a list to each class. In this case, I want to pass the SAME object to every child tests' constructor. The goal is to place setup/teardown code in one spot (and only run ONCE per suite run) allow for the tests to be split into separate classes rather than one large test unit.
>
> Thanks,
> -Greg
